results.title: Ben et Benedict = Ben and Benedict
results.brief_description:
Ben is a woman who never gets to do what she really wants to and is the victim of everybody and everything. Benedict is her imaginary creation: the girl who would respond with strength and mastery to situations Ben can only submit to. She is married to a cad who says he only married her because she was pregnant, and now he wants his freedom. Her real love is a fellow medical student who shows some interest in her. Nonetheless, she remains faithful to her unenthusiastic husband, until she becomes pregnant again. At this point she begins to act more like the Benedict of her dreams and less like the Ben she has lived as until now.

Credits: Producer, Claude Nedjar ; director, Paula Delsol ; writer, Paula Delsol ; photography, Claude Beausoleil ; music, Larry Martin ; title song, Pierre Barouh.
Cast: Francoise Lebrun, Andre Dussolier, Daniel Duval, Francois Perrier [voice only], Jacques Jeannet.

results.title: Beluga baby
results.creator_credit: Tony Westman, Christopher Pinney, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The birth of a beluga whale is a seldom witnessed event. This is a record of the birth of a whale in the Vancouver Aquarium, the excitement building up to it, the labor, and the sudden and inexplicable death of the baby. Awards: Rio de Janeiro; Missoula.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Westman, Christopher Pinney, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Berserk 6: God's Hand Ep. 22-25
results.creator_credit: Toshiaki Okuno, Toshio Nakatani, Naohito Takahashi and OLM
results.brief_description: Episodes 22-25 (final) of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 22 Griffith is being tortured but his Hawks have not given up on him. Ep. 23 The army pursues the fleeing Hawks; Griffith is very frail; Gatsu realises the depths of his feelings for Caska. Ep. 24 As Griffith hovers between life and death, the terrible truth behind his destiny is revealed. Ep. 25 Will Gatsu and Caska become sacrificial beings, as predicted? In an attempt to save her, Gatsu faces an array of marauding beasts. Final episode of “Berserk”.

results.title: Berserk 4: Devil's advocate Ep. 14-17
results.creator_credit: Toshiaki Okuno, Toshio Nakatani, Naohito Takahashi and OLM
results.brief_description: Episodes 14-17 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 14 Koska is trapped and Gatsu must face a brutal encounter with 100 soldiers. Ep. 15 Koksa has conflicted emotions about Gatsu and her devotion to Griffith. Ep. 16 With the aim of capturing Doldery, the knights face the strongest of Chuder’s army. Ep. 17 In the final battle between Midland and Chuder, the outcome means more than simply victory or defeat.

results.title: Berserk 3: White Hawk Ep. 10-13
results.creator_credit: Toshiaki Okuno, Toshio Nakatani, Naohito Takahashi and OLM
results.brief_description: Episodes 10-13 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 10 After completing a brutal assignment, Gatsu is wounded, and haunted by his actions. Ep. 11 When Griffith heads off to war, his Hawks are involved in a bloody skirmish on the front line. Ep. 12 Stranded in a cave with Gatsu, Caska relives her brutal past. Ep. 13 Wounded and trapped in enemy territory, Caska and Gatsu struggle to rejoin their battalion.

results.title: Belonging: rituals of friendship and association in an Australian country town
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: About social interaction in a small New South Wales country town. Through the lives of four men the film reveals how newcomers to a community create a network of friends and acquaintances which gives them a sense of belonging. Records discussions in various clubs and associations, and suggests that in country towns there are clearly those who “belong” and those who don’t; women, aboriginals, the poor, the unemployed.

results.title: Berfunkle
results.creator_credit: Bill Murray, Stu Knickerbocker and Portafilms
results.brief_description: Introduces the problems involved in communication; in use of words as symbols of things and concepts. This animated film considers the problems of verbal communication as it follows the humorous misadventures of a poor soul trying to find the exact meaning of the word “Berfunkle”.

results.title: Bereavement in later life
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Jo Marcus and A Webber
results.brief_description: Six retired people discuss their individual and fairly recent experiences of bereavement. Highlights the unique circumstances facing older people, including changes in lifestyle, socio-economic positions, roles, expectations and the complications that can arise. The overall aim is to show death and bereavement from an older person’s viewpoint, based on their life experiences.

results.title: Benoit [Sub-titled in English]
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Benoit is an astonishingly accomplished eleven year old Quebecois from Joliette. He persues such diverse activities as weight lifting and playing the violin. Member of the Orchestre symphonique des jeunes de Joliette, he still finds time to indulge in a busy life with peers and elders alike. This film moves at Benoit’s pace, which is mostly a fast one. (Awards: Yorkton; Lausanne).
